urls.description: List of webhook URLs to call on download events

paths.description: List of script file paths to execute on download events

enable.description: Enable automatic BT task creation when downloading .torrent files

deleteAfterDownload.description: Delete the .torrent file after BT task creation

autoExtract.description: Enable automatic extraction of archives after download

deleteAfterExtract.description: Delete the archive after successful extraction

downloadDir.description: Default directory to save downloaded files

protocolConfig.description: Protocol-specific configuration (keyed by protocol name, e.g. "http", "bt")

autoDeleteMissingFileTasks.description: Automatically delete tasks whose files are missing on disk

code.description: The response code, `0` means success, other values means error.

msg.description: The response message, if `code` != `0`, this field will contain error message.

data.description: The response data, if `code` == `0`, this field will contain response data.

InstallExtension.description: Request body for installing an extension

url.description: Git URL or local path (dev mode)

devMode.description: Enable dev mode (load from local folder)

directory.description: Sub-directory within the repository (if extension is not at root)

urls.description: URL match patterns (Chrome extension match pattern format)

labels.description: Label keys to match on requests

entry.description: Entry JS file path (relative to extension directory)

devMode.description: Whether the extension is running in dev mode

devPath.description: Local path for dev mode extensions

code.description: The response code, `0` means success, other values means error.

msg.description: The response message, if `code` != `0`, this field will contain error message.

data.description: The response data, if `code` == `0`, this field will contain response data.

msg.description: The response message, if `code` != `0`, this field will contain error message.

data.description: The response data, if `code` == `0`, this field will contain response data.

UpdateExtensionSettings.description: Request body for updating extension settings

SwitchExtension.description: Request body for switching extension enabled/disabled

status.description: true to enable, false to disable

UpdateCheckExtensionResp.description: Response body for checking extension update

newVersion.description: New version string, empty if already up-to-date

code.description: The response code, `0` means success, other values means error.

msg.description: The response message, if `code` != `0`, this field will contain error message.

data.description: The response data, if `code` == `0`, this field will contain response data.

msg.description: The response message, if `code` != `0`, this field will contain error message.

data.description: The response data, if `code` == `0`, this field will contain response data.

mode.description: Proxy mode: follow global setting, none (no proxy), or custom

url.description: Request url, support http(s) and magnet and local torrent file

proxy.description: Per-request proxy configuration. If not set, uses global proxy settings

path.description: File path, relative to the resource, e.g. "path/to"

req.description: Specify the request for this file

Resource.description: Resource info resloved from request, can contain multiple files

name.description: When name is not blank, it means that the resource is a folder resource, and the name is the folder name

range.description: Whether the resource supports breakpoint continuation

files.description: Resource files list, only when the resource is a folder resource will contain multiple files, otherwise it will only contain one file

code.description: The response code, `0` means success, other values means error.

msg.description: The response message, if `code` != `0`, this field will contain error message.

data.description: The response data, if `code` == `0`, this field will contain response data.

autoTorrent.description:
When task download complete, and it is a .torrent file, it will be auto create a new task for the torrent file.
null means use global config

deleteTorrentAfterDownload.description:
When true, deletes the .torrent file after creating BT task.
null means use global config

autoExtract.description:
When task download complete, and it is an archive file, it will be auto extracted.
null means use global config

deleteAfterExtract.description: When true, deletes the archive file after successful extraction

name.description: Specify the file name, if not set, use the name from resource

path.description: Specify the path to save the file, if not set, use the current directory

selectFiles.description: Select the index of the specified file, if not set, download all files

code.description: The response code, `0` means success, other values means error.

msg.description: The response message, if `code` != `0`, this field will contain error message.

data.description: The response data, if `code` == `0`, this field will contain response data.

PatchTask.description: Patch task request body (modify request or options of an existing task)

req.description: New request info (HTTP protocol: modify URL/headers; BT: modify tracker etc.)

opts.description: New options (e.g. change selectFiles for BT task)

multiPartBaseName.description: For multi-part archives: the base name used to group related parts

multiPartIsFirst.description: For multi-part archives: whether this is the first part

info.title: Introduction

post.description: Install an extension from a Git URL or a local folder (dev mode)

get.description: Get a single extension by identity
Check if a new version is available for an extension

post.description: Upgrade an extension to the latest version
Resolve resource info from request, contains file name, size, etc.

Create a download task, there has two ways to create a task:
1. Create a task with resolved id, it depends on the result of /api/v1/resolve API
2. Create a task directly with request

post.description: Create a batch of download tasks

patch.description:
Patch a task, modify the request or options of an existing task.
For HTTP protocol, it can modify request info (URL, headers, etc.).
For BT protocol, it can modify selectFiles.
